The original consultation and treatment planning will be separately performed. At the time of the implantation, special coordination will be required. Stepping ultrasound will be performed and utilized in the pre-planning process. Some discrepancies are frequently identified, based on the positioning, edema, and/or change in the tumor since the pre-planning process. Re-assessment is required at the time of surgery, evaluating the pre-plan and comparing to the stepping ultrasound. layman:
PROSTATE BRACHYTHERAPY – I‑125 SEED PLANTING

The patient will receive a prostate treatment that uses ultrasound to guide the placement of I‑125 radioactive seeds. The initial consultation and treatment plan are done separately. When the seeds are implanted, special coordination is needed. A stepping ultrasound is used during the pre‑planning stage. Often, differences appear because of the prostate’s position, swelling, or changes in the tumor since the plan was made. Therefore, the surgeon must re‑check the plan at the time of the procedure, comparing it to the stepping ultrasound. Adjustments are made right away, adding or removing needles and seeds as needed. This process is done together with the seed‑loading by the brachytherapist and coordinated with the urologist, dosimetrist, or physicist. The brachytherapy is tailored to each patient’s tumor and prostate. Care is taken before and during the operation to avoid giving too much dose to the rectum and bladder.
